instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 doesn?t recognize hdd
threads.message:
Hi I have another [URL="tel:820-2915"]820-2915[/URL] that doesn?t recognize the hdd.
ive never encountered this before so I?m basically stumped :( my first instinct is power but I hear the drive. So I?m checking data lines all I get in the screen is a flashing folder. internet recovery also fails

threads.title: 820-2915 doesn?t recognize hdd
threads.message:
Usually bad HDD cable; if machine worked before with the same HDD.
Also is possible that no OSX particion exists, or APFS not supported in BIOS; if HDD was changed, or BIOS messed up.

Try first to boot USB OSX and check if Disk Utility recognizes internal HDD, at least.
Test known good working HDD and flex too.

threads.title: 820-2915 doesn?t recognize hdd
threads.message:
Yes I?m using test known good hdd cable and 2 test drives boots from the another 820-2915b OS X Lion dvd won?t install either will try a usb install and get back to you 
thanks

threads.title: 820-2915 doesn?t recognize hdd
threads.message: Yes it does recognize the drive. Using a usb with OS X. Can erase but not install and it won?t boot from a working drive :/

threads.title: 820-2915 doesn?t recognize hdd
threads.message:
Can you format internal HDD, as Mac OS Extended?
Check integrity of all resistors, caps and traces around J4501 and U4510.
